units.name: How can design and innovation help to optimise chemical processes?

areasOfStudy.name: What are the current and future options for supplying energy?

topics.name: Fuel Definitions
topics.subtitle: Fossil fuels vs biofuels
dotPoints: The definition of a fuel, including the distinction between fossil fuels and biofuels with reference to renewability

topics.name: Food as Energy
topics.subtitle: Carbohydrates, proteins, lipids
dotPoints: Fuel sources for the body measured in kJ g⁻¹: carbohydrates, proteins and lipids

topics.name: Photosynthesis
topics.subtitle: Light to chemical energy
dotPoints: Photosynthesis as the process that converts light energy into chemical energy: 6CO₂ + 6H₂O → C₆H₁₂O₆ + 6O₂

topics.name: Cellular Respiration
topics.subtitle: Glucose oxidation
dotPoints: Oxidation of glucose as the primary carbohydrate energy source: C₆H₁₂O₆ + 6O₂ → 6CO₂ + 6H₂O

topics.name: Bioethanol Production
topics.subtitle: Fermentation and distillation
dotPoints: Production of bioethanol by fermentation of glucose and subsequent distillation: C₆H₁₂O₆ → 2C₂H₅OH + 2CO₂

topics.name: Enthalpy Changes
topics.subtitle: Exothermic and endothermic
dotPoints: Comparison of exothermic and endothermic reactions with reference to bond making/breaking, enthalpy changes (ΔH) and energy profile diagrams

topics.name: Limiting Reactants
topics.subtitle: Determining excess reagents
dotPoints: Determination of limiting reactants or reagents in chemical reactions

topics.name: Combustion Reactions
topics.subtitle: Complete and incomplete
dotPoints: Combustion reactions of fuels as exothermic reactions: balanced thermochemical equations for complete and incomplete combustion

topics.name: Stoichiometry
topics.subtitle: Mass-mass, mass-volume calculations
dotPoints: Calculations related to stoichiometry of combustion reactions including mass-mass, mass-volume and volume-volume calculations

topics.name: Specific Heat Capacity
topics.subtitle: q = mcΔT
dotPoints: The use of specific heat capacity of water to approximate heat energy released during combustion

topics.name: Solution Calorimetry
topics.subtitle: Calibration and heat loss
dotPoints: Principles of solution calorimetry including calibration factor, heat loss effects, and temperature-time graph analysis

topics.name: Energy Efficiency
topics.subtitle: Food and fuel energy values
dotPoints: Energy transformation efficiency calculations and comparison of energy values of foods

topics.name: Redox Reactions
topics.subtitle: Oxidation numbers
dotPoints: Redox reactions as simultaneous oxidation and reduction processes using oxidation numbers to identify agents

topics.name: Half Equations
topics.subtitle: Acidic and basic conditions
dotPoints: Writing balanced half-equations for oxidation and reduction in acidic and basic conditions

topics.name: Galvanic Cells
topics.subtitle: Primary cell design
dotPoints: Design features and operating principles of primary galvanic cells converting chemical to electrical energy

topics.name: Electrochemical Series
topics.subtitle: Predicting reactions
dotPoints: Use and limitations of the electrochemical series in designing galvanic cells and predicting redox products

topics.name: Fuel Cells
topics.subtitle: Porous electrodes
dotPoints: Design features and operating principles of fuel cells including porous electrodes for gaseous reactants

topics.name: Faraday's Laws (Galvanic)
topics.subtitle: m = MIt/nF
dotPoints: Application of Faraday's Laws and stoichiometry to galvanic and fuel cell calculations

topics.name: Green Chemistry & Fuel Cells
topics.subtitle: Energy efficiency principles
dotPoints: Innovation in fuel cell design with reference to green chemistry principles: energy efficiency and renewable feedstocks

areasOfStudy.name: How can the rate and yield of chemical reactions be optimised?

topics.name: Collision Theory
topics.subtitle: Factors affecting rate
dotPoints: Factors affecting frequency and success of collisions: temperature, surface area, concentration, pressure, catalyst, activation energy, orientation

topics.name: Catalysts
topics.subtitle: Alternative pathways
dotPoints: Role of catalysts in increasing rate with reference to alternative reaction pathways and energy profile diagrams

topics.name: Reversible Reactions
topics.subtitle: Rate vs extent
dotPoints: Distinction between reversible and irreversible reactions, and between rate and extent of a reaction

topics.name: Dynamic Equilibrium
topics.subtitle: Concentration-time graphs
dotPoints: Dynamic nature of homogeneous equilibria and their representation by equations and concentration-time graphs

topics.name: Equilibrium Shifts
topics.subtitle: Temperature, concentration, pressure
dotPoints: Changes in position of equilibrium when temperature, species concentration, or volume/pressure changes are applied

topics.name: Le Chatelier's Principle
topics.subtitle: Predicting yield changes
dotPoints: Application of Le Chatelier's principle to identify factors that favour yield of a reaction

topics.name: Equilibrium Constant
topics.subtitle: K expressions and calculations
dotPoints: Calculations involving equilibrium expressions and dependence of K on temperature and equation representation

topics.name: Reaction Quotient
topics.subtitle: Q vs K
dotPoints: The reaction quotient (Q) as a measure of extent of reaction at a given point in time

topics.name: Rate vs Yield Optimisation
topics.subtitle: Industrial considerations
dotPoints: Responses to conflict between optimal rate and temperature in equilibrium reactions with green chemistry principles

topics.name: Electrolysis Predictions
topics.subtitle: Using electrochemical series
dotPoints: Use of electrochemical series to predict electrolysis products given state and electrode materials

topics.name: Electrolytic Cells
topics.subtitle: Design and operation
dotPoints: Design features and operating principles of commercial electrolytic cells including electrode selection

topics.name: Rechargeable Cells
topics.subtitle: Secondary cells
dotPoints: Design features of rechargeable cells: discharging as galvanic, recharging as electrolytic, electrode polarities

topics.name: Green Hydrogen
topics.subtitle: PEM and artificial photosynthesis
dotPoints: Innovation in producing green hydrogen via PEM electrolysis and artificial photosynthesis

topics.name: Faraday's Laws (Electrolysis)
topics.subtitle: Electrolytic calculations
dotPoints: Application of Faraday's Laws and stoichiometry to electrolytic cell calculations

units.name: How are carbon-based compounds designed for purpose?

areasOfStudy.name: How are organic compounds categorised and synthesised?

topics.name: Carbon Atom Characteristics
topics.subtitle: Bonding and isomers
dotPoints: Characteristics of carbon contributing to diversity: valence electrons, bond strength, stability, unsaturation, isomers

topics.name: Organic Formulas
topics.subtitle: Molecular and structural
dotPoints: Molecular, structural, semi-structural and skeletal formulas of organic compound classes

topics.name: IUPAC Nomenclature
topics.subtitle: Systematic naming
dotPoints: IUPAC systematic naming of organic compounds up to C8 with no more than two functional groups

topics.name: Physical Properties
topics.subtitle: Boiling point, viscosity trends
dotPoints: Trends in physical properties within and between homologous series with reference to structure and bonding

topics.name: Organic Reactions
topics.subtitle: Substitution, addition, esterification
dotPoints: Organic reactions including substitution, addition, esterification, hydrolysis, transesterification

topics.name: Yield and Atom Economy
topics.subtitle: Efficiency calculations
dotPoints: Percentage yield and atom economy calculations for organic synthesis

topics.name: Green Chemistry (Organic)
topics.subtitle: Sustainable synthesis
dotPoints: Green chemistry principles applied to organic synthesis

areasOfStudy.name: How are organic compounds analysed and used?

topics.name: Qualitative Tests
topics.subtitle: Functional group identification
dotPoints: Qualitative tests to detect the presence of C=C, -OH, and -COOH functional groups

topics.name: Melting Point & Purity
topics.subtitle: Determining purity
dotPoints: The use of melting point determination to confirm identification and assess purity of organic compounds

topics.name: Distillation
topics.subtitle: Simple and fractional
dotPoints: Separation of organic compounds by simple distillation and fractional distillation

topics.name: Iodine Number
topics.subtitle: Degree of unsaturation
dotPoints: The use of iodine number as a measure of degree of unsaturation of edible fats and oils

topics.name: Redox Titrations
topics.subtitle: Primary standard analysis
dotPoints: Redox titrations with suitable primary standard to determine concentration using relevant equations

topics.name: Mass Spectrometry
topics.subtitle: Molecular ion and fragments
dotPoints: Mass spectrometry for determining molecular mass and structural formula from fragmentation patterns

topics.name: Infrared Spectroscopy
topics.subtitle: Characteristic absorptions
dotPoints: Infrared spectroscopy for detecting presence of bonds using characteristic absorption bands

topics.name: ¹³C-NMR Spectroscopy
topics.subtitle: Carbon environments
dotPoints: ¹³C-NMR spectroscopy for determining number of carbon environments from chemical shifts

topics.name: ¹H-NMR Spectroscopy
topics.subtitle: Proton environments and splitting
dotPoints: ¹H-NMR spectroscopy for determining hydrogen environments, ratio of hydrogens, and n+1 splitting rule

topics.name: HPLC
topics.subtitle: Retention times and calibration
dotPoints: High-performance liquid chromatography for identification and quantification using retention times and calibration curves

topics.name: Combined Spectroscopy
topics.subtitle: Structure determination
dotPoints: Structure determination from analysis of multiple spectra (MS, IR, ¹³C-NMR, ¹H-NMR)

topics.name: Medicines from Nature
topics.subtitle: Extraction and purification
dotPoints: Extraction and purification of compounds from natural sources for use as medicines

topics.name: Functional Groups in Medicines
topics.subtitle: Structure-function relationships
dotPoints: Role of functional groups in medicines and their interactions with biological systems

topics.name: Chirality
topics.subtitle: Enantiomers in medicine
dotPoints: Chirality and the existence of enantiomers and their significance in medicinal effectiveness

topics.name: Enzyme Structure
topics.subtitle: Primary to quaternary
dotPoints: Structure of enzymes from primary to quaternary and effects of temperature and pH

topics.name: Enzyme Inhibitors
topics.subtitle: Competitive inhibition
dotPoints: The action of competitive enzyme inhibitors and lock-and-key mechanism in medicine development
